intro: Camissonia bolanderi, commonly known as Bolander's camissonia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. This species typically grows in rocky habitats and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are often narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Camissonia bolanderi is a perennial plant that blooms in late spring or early summer.
